intro: Aragallus angustatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf aragallus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Aragallus angustatus is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
